result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dmondre Damarius Brooks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dmondre Damarius Brooks in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Dmondre Damarius Brooks.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn requests a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dmondre Damarius Brooks in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Dmondre Damarius Brooks.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled and parties requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dmondre Damarius Brooks in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Flynn has received discovery, is waiting on an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LG.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Dmondre Damarius Brooks in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-6-2022 @2p
